subject: Re: [junit] JUnit not matching to my needs - execute order shows design flaw ?
msgSnippet: ... With equally great respect, even though the code smell, Curt must test it. -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services http://www.diasparsoftware.com
messageBody:
Jason Rogers wrote:

> On Wednesday 07 July 2004 10:49 pm, Curt Sampson wrote:
> > On Tue, 6 Jul 2004, hedgi wrote:
> > > Now I there is the problem. I want to run "testCommon" first
> > > which is in the "BasicGetListTest" but when I subclass it with
> > > "GlucoseGetListTest" it is always executed last. I read some of
> > > the postings in this newsgroup, but it seems that such kind of
> > > requirement point a desing flaw and I should somehow rearrange my
> > > Unit Test Structure to made the tests indepentdant. I'm stuck with
> > > it.
> >
> > I've been thinking for a while that this is a serious problem in JUnit
> > (and most unit testing frameworks), because it's been such an annoyance
> > for so many people. Let's face it; a lot of groups of tests do have
> > known dependencies between tests such that if test A fails, we know that
> > the output of tests B, C and D are uninteresting. Yet we end up running
> > B, C and D anyway, and then searching through all the error output for
> > the failure that we know is the "real" one, ignoring all the others as
> > spurious.
>
> With all due respect, I believe that is a code smell.

With equally great respect, even though the code smell, Curt must test it.
--
